paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses variants in the KCNH2 gene, specifically focusing on the variant p.R164H, which was identified but did not segregate with the disease phenotype.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Clinical genetic testing of the individuals with phenotypic QT prolongation for variants in congenital long QT syndrome (cLQTS) related genes revealed a variant of unknown significance in KCNH2 p.R164H (Clinvar, VCV000067508.8) that did not segregate with the disease phenotype.

functional_data.summary: The variant was identified but did not show segregation with the disease phenotype.

variants.segregation_data: The variant did not segregate with the disease phenotype.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was classified as a variant of unknown significance (VUS).
key_quotes: Clinical genetic testing of the individuals with phenotypic QT prolongation for variants in congenital long QT syndrome (cLQTS) related genes revealed a variant of unknown significance in KCNH2 p.R164H (Clinvar, VCV000067508.8) that did not segregate with the disease phenotype.

extraction_metadata.notes: Only one variant in KCNH2 was found and extracted.
